attributes.action: 'I'm not a Kerb Crawler!" - Tighten up the Kerb-Crawling Law
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
From 1st April 2010, upon the enactment of Part 2 of the Policing and Crime Act 2009, the ‘persistent’ and ‘motor vehicle’ element to have committed the offence of 'kerb crawling' will be amended, meaning it will become an
offence to solicit another person/s in a street or public place. 

Within the current law, although not perfectly clear, it is at the least distinguishable that in order to have to been found 'kerb crawling', that one must have demonstrated an obvious element of ‘persistence’ and or nuisance behaviour to be considered to have committed this offence. The change in the law from 1st April 2010 will mean the Act may criminalise innocent
individuals, particularly men, who are found to simply be in the street or public area committing actions that could be deemed to be soliciting. 

This petition asks for the law to be amended.

rejection.details:
Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.

We suggest you remove the quote from the title of your petition.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
